alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Lucie and eastern Martin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sewall`s Point, or over Stuart, moving east at 10 mph. This group of storms was building southward down the coast across Martin County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jupiter, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart and Tequesta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
